IndexTraversal.Description: Enable intelligent traversal of graphs and registries, leveraging metadata, weighting, and contextual reasoning to efficiently navigate and locate items.

Instructions.Description: Load the theme.registry.json to identify related mini-graphs based on query keywords and weights.
Match the query context (keywords, descriptions, paths) against entries in the theme.registry.json and registry.json. Select the highest weighted matches above the threshold.
Load related mini-graphs identified from theme.registry.json or registry.json to begin traversal. Use weighting to prioritize graphs with the most relevance to the query.
If theme and registry matches are insufficient, traverse through mini-graphs. Expand to cache.graph.json or core.graph.json as a last resort.
Combine keywords from mini-graphs, theme.registry.json, and registry.json to dynamically infer new relationships and expand traversal pathways.
Allow configurable traversal depth to limit or expand directory exploration. Default to shallow exploration unless deeper traversal is required.
Cache matched graphs and paths for frequently accessed queries to optimize future traversal operations.
Enable direct keyword searches across registry and theme.registry for precise query matches, prioritizing files with high keyword density.
